headers: DEEP IMAGINATION PRIORITIES — WHERE TO GO DEEPER BEFORE PRODUCTION

rows.DEEP IMAGINATION PRIORITIES — WHERE TO G: These 5 artifacts need full depth BEFORE production starts. They're recruiting tools, not just planning docs.

rows.col_3: Complete production spec for the live show
rows.col_4: This is what you show MC candidates. If they can't SEE the show, they won't say yes to 10% equity in something abstract.
rows.col_5: Format spec (long-form + daily highlight). Thumbnail style mockups (AI-generated). Set design / background spec. 3 sample episode scripts (onboarding, expert review, milestone). AI mockup of what the YouTube/social feed looks like with 20 episodes posted. Channel name, description, visual identity.

rows.col_3: 5-slide deck every hire sees before saying yes
rows.col_4: Equity-only hiring requires a compelling story. Without this, every recruiting conversation starts from zero and you're selling verbally every time.
rows.col_5: Slide 1: What we're building (IonWave + the coordination thesis). Slide 2: Why now (100M+ views at Tabs, flash teams model, $25M raised). Slide 3: What you get (equity, career booster, show appearance, co-founder credit). Slide 4: The team so far (who's already in). Slide 5: Your specific role + comp. AI-designed, professional, sendable.

rows.col_3: The real locked thesis — ICP, positioning, kill criteria, competitive stance
rows.col_4: Every TUP reads from M0. If M0 is a template with placeholders, every downstream TUP is building on sand. This is the Claude calibration test input.
rows.col_5: Real ICP with specific demographics, psychographics, buying triggers. Real positioning vs LMNT/Liquid IV/Seaonic. Real kill criteria (what would make us stop). Real competitive analysis with actual data. Not "premium electrolyte for health-conscious consumers" — the REAL thesis.

rows.col_3: What an expert receives when asked to review
rows.col_4: Experts are busy and skeptical. A clean, professional packet makes them say yes. A sloppy ask makes them ghost.
rows.col_5: One-page overview of what IonWave is. Their specific cluster scope (which TUPs, what domain). Sample V-tab filled out with a real grade + real review notes (so they know what "done" looks like). Time commitment (10-20 hours). Comp (0.1-0.25% equity + name on output + show appearance). Sample graded TUP from the calibration test.

rows.col_3: AI-generated product page, landing page, packaging renders
rows.col_4: Investors and hires need to SEE the brand. A spreadsheet with 1,195 tabs is impressive but abstract. A beautiful product page makes it real.
rows.col_5: AI-generated product packaging (pouch/stick pack renders). Landing page mockup with hero image, value props, pricing. Product page with supplement facts panel mockup. 3-4 lifestyle images (AI-generated). Brand color palette, typography, visual identity applied. This is a MOCKUP — not live. Just enough to make people go "oh, this is real."
rows.col_6: Nilo + Claude (Conductor builds live version later)

rows.DEEP IMAGINATION PRIORITIES — WHERE TO G: THESE ARE RECRUITING WEAPONS, NOT PLANNING DOCS
The show bible recruits the MC. The pitch deck recruits everyone. M0 makes Claude useful. The expert packet recruits advisors. The storefront mockup recruits investors.
If you build these 5 artifacts in Week 0-1, every recruiting conversation after that is "look at this, want in?" instead of "let me explain what we're doing."
The order matters: M0 first (everything reads from it), then pitch deck + show bible (recruiting tools), then expert packet + storefront (downstream recruiting).
